    Get started

    get-started.Rmd
    library(stadlColorPaletteR)

    Include some data examples in your package

    Functions to generate color palettes

    Extract hex-code of colors specified in a tibble 

    datafile <- system.file("mycolors.csv", 
                        package = "stadlColorPaletteR")
mycolors <- readr::read_csv(datafile)
#> Rows: 5 Columns: 2
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr (2): color_names, hex_code
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
get_color_hex_code('palevioletred2', base_colors = mycolors)
#> [1] "#EE799F"

    Generate colors for later interpolation 

    datafile <- system.file("mycolors.csv", 
                        package = "stadlColorPaletteR")
mycolors <- readr::read_csv(datafile)
#> Rows: 5 Columns: 2
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr (2): color_names, hex_code
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

# combinations with 2 colors
generate_colors_to_interpolate(mycolors, 2)
#> $pal1
#> [1] "#FAFAD2" "#E066FF"
#> 
#> $pal2
#> [1] "#FAFAD2" "#424242"
#> 
#> $pal3
#> [1] "#FAFAD2" "#EE799F"
#> 
#> $pal4
#> [1] "#FAFAD2" "#6B6B6B"
#> 
#> $pal5
#> [1] "#E066FF" "#424242"
#> 
#> $pal6
#> [1] "#E066FF" "#EE799F"
#> 
#> $pal7
#> [1] "#E066FF" "#6B6B6B"
#> 
#> $pal8
#> [1] "#424242" "#EE799F"
#> 
#> $pal9
#> [1] "#424242" "#6B6B6B"
#> 
#> $pal10
#> [1] "#EE799F" "#6B6B6B"

#combinations with all colors
generate_colors_to_interpolate(mycolors, nrow(mycolors))
#> $pal1
#> [1] "#FAFAD2" "#E066FF" "#424242" "#EE799F" "#6B6B6B"

    Access and interpolate colors 

    datafile <- system.file("mycolors.csv", 
                        package = "stadlColorPaletteR")
mycolors <- readr::read_csv(datafile)
#> Rows: 5 Columns: 2
#> ── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> Delimiter: ","
#> chr (2): color_names, hex_code
#> 
#> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
#> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

# combinations with 2 colors
base_cols <- generate_colors_to_interpolate(mycolors, 2)

# interpolate first element of base_cols
mycolors_interpolated <- color_palette(
  colors_to_interpolate = 'pal1',
  base_colors = base_cols
)

    Inflate your package

    You’re one inflate from paper to box. Build your package from this very Rmd using fusen::inflate()

    • Verify your "DESCRIPTION" file has been updated
    • Verify your function is in "R/" directory
    • Verify your test is in "tests/testthat/" directory
    • Verify this Rmd appears in "vignettes/" directory
